content: Fresh Graduates Career General Asked by Jay LiuAsked on 15 Sep 2018If you have a full time job, will you want to work part time to have more income on the weekends?12 answersAnswerBump2
Answers (12)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Steph Yeo, Auntie Uncle Whisperer at Agency for Integrated CareLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 20 Sep 2018When i was feeling like shi* at my previous job because i didn't like what i was doing, a colleague told me,  "don't expect to love your full time job. Do what you love as something part time so you have money from your full time job and still can do what you like after that."I guess my takeaway is that whatever i do beyond my full time job has to be really worth my time. Something that i really like to do, instead of sth that just brings in cash. 0 comments1
Good Day Every DayLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018No, health is equally important. You need to be healthy to earn more or to start a business in the future. 0 comments1

Jeff Yeo,   amateur Social contributor  at School of social sharingLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 04 Jan 2019If you are young and in good health why not ? Always good to to build up capital early.0 comments0
Nicholas ChanLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 18 Sep 2018Depends on how onerous my full time job is. I& the part time job is something I'm passionate about, then  yes0 comments0

ZeeeeeLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 18 Sep 2018If you have a skill which you are passionate about (ie making music for myself) you could teach that over the weekends for an extra side income of a few thousand dollars:)0 comments0

JianHao SooLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 15 Sep 2018Yes I will consider doing part time job on a weekend if there it's something that I am interested in exploring. It can be something you use to improve your CV and job-hop when opportunity comes. 0 comments0

Teresa WuLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 15 Sep 2018I would if the job would help me in the long run. For example, if it allows me to improve a skill i would like to master or for networking purposes.
I would take up the job too if it something i like do as a hobby. 
Example, like baking cakes on the side.. Or like make up services during weekends to brides..0 comments0

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018It depends on whether I need the money, as well as whether I have time for that. If I have to regularly bring work (from weekdays) back home to do, then I will have no time for any other types of work as I'd want to spend time with family and friends too!0 comments0

HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 15 Sep 2018Yes part-time bit not in wekeend but on weekday night or along side anytime possible. This is to have an extra stream of income for achieving any Target or as a backup income in case lose of main job. Not to forget , the part time side income if is good and mature may one day be your own business.  0 comments0

Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018I'll do my budgeting to ensure that I save and won't overspend unnecessarily. However, I wouldn't do so (part time on weekends) unless I desperately need the money as I prefer to have work-life balance where I either rest or spend time with my family & friends 0 comments0

Jasmine TsoiLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 15 Sep 2018Depends on how much I'm being paid for my part time job to justify spending my rest time on it! If I'm paid more than $20 an hour I'll consider it so that I can get more money to save and invest with :) 0 comments0

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018If my full time job is not very tiring, I will consider as I can retire earlier. But you have to spend time with family as well so it depends on situations i guess.0 comments0
